intro: Lappa platylepis, commonly known as the broad-leaved lappa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, flat leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to parts of Asia, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a notable addition to gardens and natural habitats. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
